message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is primarily focused on improving the performance of neural machine translation (NMT) systems, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also introduces convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to augment the softmax and embedding layers of the NMT system, which falls under the category of machine learning (ML). Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of a simple approximate softmax layer, which is a technique commonly used in neural networks for handling large vocabularies, falling under the category of neural networks (NE). Finally, the paper also mentions the use of character-level embeddings, which is a technique commonly used in computer vision (CV) for image recognition tasks. Therefore, cs.CV is also a possible sub-category.
